unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of activity in recent weeks with several key launches catering to diverse consumer needs. Dr. Kalam Automotive Research Institute highlighted the growing trend of electric vehicles (EVs), noting a 35% increase in EV sales compared to last year.
normalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of activity in recent weeks with several key launches catering to diverse consumer needs. Doctor Kalam Automotive Research Institute highlighted the growing trend of electric vehicles (E V s), noting a thirty five percent increase in E V sales compared to last year.

unnormalised: Mahindra & Mahindra launched the "Scorpio-N Adventure Edition" in Leh, promising enhanced off-roading capabilities with a ground clearance of 220 mm. Tata Motors unveiled its new CNG variant of the Tiago, boasting a fuel efficiency of 34 km/kg.
normalised: Mahindra and Mahindra launched the "Scorpio-N Adventure Edition" in Leh, promising enhanced off-roading capabilities with a ground clearance of two hundred and twenty millimeter. Tata Motors unveiled its new C N G variant of the Tiago, boasting a fuel efficiency of thirty four kilometer per kilogram.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki introduced a limited-edition Baleno, featuring a premium interior with 10-inch infotainment screen and a spacious cabin of around 450 sq ft, targeting young urban buyers. These launches reflect the industry's focus on innovation, sustainability, and catering to the evolving preferences of the Indian consumer. Market analysts predict a price hike of around Rs. 15,000 - Rs. 20,000 across segments due to rising input costs in the coming months. Stay tuned for more updates.
normalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki introduced a limited-edition Baleno, featuring a premium interior with ten-inch infotainment screen and a spacious cabin of around four hundred and fifty square feet, targeting young urban buyers. These launches reflect the industry's focus on innovation, sustainability, and catering to the evolving preferences of the Indian consumer. Market analysts predict a price hike of around rupee fifteen thousand to rupee twenty thousand across segments due to rising input costs in the coming months. Stay tuned for more updates.
